intro: Ammannia senegalensis f. confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features alternate, lanceolate leaves with a distinctive blue-green hue and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands or along water bodies. Its compact growth and dense inflorescences make it a notable species in ecological and ornamental contexts.
